DataElement.preferredName: Body Image Scale Past Few Weeks Feel Less Feminine Due To Disease Or Treatment Score 4 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A person's stated observation of how much they have had a feeling of being less feminine due to their disease or treatment in the past few weeks, using a four point Likert scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Body Image Scale Past Few Weeks Feeling Less Feminine Due To Disease Or Treatment Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A brief questionnaire for assessing body image changes in patients with cancer._Past; before the present time._An indefinite but relatively small number._Any period of seven consecutive days._A person's stated observation of their feeling of being less feminine as a result of their disease or treatment._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A brief questionnaire for assessing body image changes in patients with cancer.

Concepts.definition: A brief questionnaire for assessing body image changes in patients with cancer.

Property.preferredName: Past Few Week Feeling Less Feminine Due to Disease or Treatment Score
Property.preferredDefinition: Past; before the present time.:An indefinite but relatively small number.:Any period of seven consecutive days.:A person's stated observation of their feeling of being less feminine as a result of their disease or treatment.:A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.definition: An indefinite but relatively small number.
Any period of seven consecutive days.

Concepts.longName: Feel Less Feminine Due to Disease or Treatment
Concepts.definition: A question about whether an individual feels or felt less feminine as a result of their disease or treatment.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

DataElementConcept.origin: BIS:Body Image Scale Hopwood P, Fletcher I, Lee A, et al: A body image scale for use with cancer patients. European Journal of Cancer 37:189-197, 2001.
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created and released for Alliance per request/approval by KA.Ziegler and K.Burger. mc 12/17/12

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: How much there is of something that you can measure; the total amount or number._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability._A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::4_The precise location of something; a spatially limited location._An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective answer of no agreement or ability.

Concepts.definition: A subjective answer of no agreement or ability.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective answer of weak agreement.

Concepts.definition: A subjective answer of weak agreement.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective answer describing a fairly large amount or extent.

Concepts.definition: A subjective answer describing a fairly large amount or extent.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: How much there is of something that you can measure; the total amount or number.:A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.:A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::4:The precise location of something; a spatially limited location.:an ordered reference standard.

Concepts.definition: How much there is of something that you can measure; the total amount or number.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.
A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
The precise location of something; a spatially limited location.
An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.
